intro: Echinoglochin acanthocarpa, commonly known as the spiny globe thistle, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its spiny, globe-shaped inflorescence and silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Echinoglochin acanthocarpa is known for its drought tolerance and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
